Function Documentation

NITF_BOOL nitf_Extensions_appendTRE (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
nitf_TRE *  tre,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Insert a tre into the extensions section. The object will be added as follows. If such an object exists in the hash already, this object will be added to the next pointer link.

1.3 Release

This function replaces the 1.2 nitf_Extensions_insert() There is a new nitf_Extensions_insert() function which uses iterators, but this appendTRE function will simply place it at the end

Parameters:
name The name of the TRE to insert
tre The tre to insert
Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

nitf_ExtensionsIterator nitf_Extensions_begin (  nitf_Extensions *  ext  ) 
 

The begin method produces an ExtensionsIterator that points at the beginning of the Extensions object. If "dereferenced," the iterator will produce the first TRE within the extension.

Parameters:
ext The extensions segment
Returns:
An iterator pointing at the beginning of the extension

nitf_Extensions* nitf_Extensions_clone (  nitf_Extensions *  source,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Clone this object. This is a deep copy operation.

Parameters:
source The source object
error An error to populate upon failure
Returns:
A new object that is identical to the old

nitf_Uint32 nitf_Extensions_computeLength (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
nitf_Version  fver,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Computes the length of the extension based on its current state.

This basically just adds up the lengths of all of the TREs it holds.

Parameters:
ext The extension segment
fver The version
error The error to populate on failure
Returns:
the length

nitf_Extensions* nitf_Extensions_construct (  nitf_Error *  error  ) 
 

Construct the extensions section. These may exist in almost any part of the NITF file. In essence, this object is a data store of information that was provided in data extensions.

Parameters:
error An object to be populated on error
Returns:
NULL on failure, the object otherwise

void nitf_Extensions_destruct (  nitf_Extensions **  ext  ) 
 

Destruct the extensions section. This removes the hash values and deletes everything.

Parameters:
ext The address of an extensions pointer

nitf_ExtensionsIterator nitf_Extensions_end (  nitf_Extensions *  ext  ) 
 

The end method produces an ExtensionsIterator that points at the end of the Extensions object. If "dereferenced," the iterator will produce the final TRE within the extension.

Parameters:
ext The extensions segment
Returns:
An iterator pointing at the end of the extension

NITF_BOOL nitf_Extensions_exists (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
const char *  name
) 
 

Checks if the TRE of the given name exists

Parameters:
name The name of the TRE
Returns:
1 if exists, 0 otherwise

nitf_List* nitf_Extensions_getTREsByName (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
const char *  name
) 
 

Parameters:
name The name of the TRE
Returns:
The TRE that is retrieved from the hash

NITF_BOOL nitf_Extensions_insert (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
nitf_ExtensionsIterator *  extIter,
nitf_TRE *  tre,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Insert a TRE instance into the extensions location after this position

See also:
nitf_List_insert at the iterator location. This function is new for 1.3
Parameters:
ext The name of the extensions object
extIter The iterator
tre The TRE to insert
An error to populate on failure
Returns:
NITF_SUCCESS or NITF_FAILURE

nitf_TRE* nitf_Extensions_remove (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
nitf_ExtensionsIterator *  extIter,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Remove a TRE instance at the iterator location. This function is new for 1.3

Parameters:
ext The name of the extensions object
extIter The iterator
tre The TRE to insert
An error to populate on failure
Returns:
NITF_SUCCESS or NITF_FAILURE

void nitf_Extensions_removeTREsByName (  nitf_Extensions *  ext,
const char *  name
) 
 

This function replaces the 1.2 nitf_Extensions_erase() function, which was incorrectly implemented.

Remove all instances of a given TRE from this extensions object.

Parameters:
ext The name of the TRE to remove

NITF_BOOL nitf_ExtensionsIterator_equals (  nitf_ExtensionsIterator *  it1,
nitf_ExtensionsIterator *  it2
) 
 

Check for equality in iterators. This is typically done for looping purposes.

Parameters:

it2 The second iterator to compare
Returns:
True if the iterators are equal

Produce the TRE at this location ("dereference"). This function modified for 1.3

Parameters:

Returns:
The TRE that the iterator is pointing at

Increments the extensions iterator

nitf_ExtensionsIterator *  it2
